itemDescription: (1802-1887) Advocate, Provost, and first Lord Provost, of Aberdeen, instrumental in the creation of the Great North of Scotland railway.

wikipedia_page.main: Sir Alexander Anderson of Blelack (1802–1887) was a 19th-century Scottish advocate and politician who served as Lord Provost of Aberdeen from 1859 to 1866 and is viewed as one of the major forces in moulding the city.
